name: pyrinoline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1432
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -109.4°C. The basic unit for this compound can be considered 1,3-dioxane, which has a melting point of -109.4°C. The additional functional groups and structural features in pyrinoline will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The pyrrole ring (c2ccccn2) and furan ring (c3ccccn3) may both add roughly +10 due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact; (3) The methoxy group (c4ccccn4) may add approximately +5 due to increasing the molecular weight and van der Waals forces; (4) The ethoxy group (c5ccccn5) may add approximately +5 due to increasing the molecular weight and van der Waals forces. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
